etymologies: mid 16th century: from the obsolete adjective fledge ‘ready to fly’, from Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vlug ‘quick, agile’, also to fly

definitions: (of a young bird) develop wing feathers that are large enough for flight

examples.text: the young fledge around four weeks after hatching

shortDefinitions: (of young bird) develop wing feathers that are large enough for flight

definitions: bring up (a young bird) until its wing feathers are developed enough for flight

examples.text: they fledged twenty-four chicks in fourteen months

shortDefinitions: bring up young bird until its wing feathers are developed enough for flight
